Name: Burpee Fordhook Tampala
Characteristics: dark-green leaves, erect bushy plants, used as raw or cooked greens. Withstands heat better than spinach.
Adaptation: all parts of the United States. Burpee Catalog 1946.
Parentage: selection from Burpee Tampala for darker green leaf color.

Name: Burpee Tampala
Characteristics: light-green leaves borne on bushy plants that are slow bolting and withstand hot weather much better than spinach.
Parentage: cultivar of Amaranthus gangeticus brought from China by L. Lutz.

Name: Burpee's Red Tampala
Characteristics: dark-red-centered leaves, bushy plants that are slow bolting and withstand hot weather much better than spinach.
Parentage: cultivar of Amaranthus gangeticus brought from China by Ernest L. Lutz.
